revised_title: Luminous Vapours Distilled from the Arc: Applications to the Study of Spectrum Series and their Origin
tldr: The author investigates the effect of electric fields on the luminosity of mercury vapour and its relation to the study of spectrum series. The experiments reveal that the luminosity is not affected when the stream of vapour passes the anode, but is extinguished near the cathode, depending on the shape and position of the cathode.
